definitions.text: a written document describing the findings of some individual or group
examples: this accords with the recent study by Hill and Dale

definitions.text: the act of informing by verbal report
examples: he heard reports that they were causing trouble
by all accounts they were a happy couple

definitions.text: a short account of the news
examples: the story was on the 11 o'clock news
the account of his speech that was given on the evening news made the governor furious

definitions.text: a sharp explosive sound (especially the sound of a gun firing)
examples: they heard a violent report followed by silence

definitions.text: a written evaluation of a student's scholarship and deportment
examples: his father signed his report card

definitions.text: an essay (especially one written as an assignment)
examples: he got an A on his composition

definitions.text: the general estimation that the public has for a person
examples: he acquired a reputation as an actor before he started writing
he was a person of bad report

definitions.text: to give an account or representation of in words
examples: Discreet Italian police described it in a manner typically continental

definitions.text: announce as the result of an investigation or experience or finding
examples: Dozens of incidents of wife beatings are reported daily in this city
The team reported significant advances in their research
I report to work every day at 9 o'clock
One student reported the other to the principal

definitions.text: be responsible for reporting the details of, as in journalism
examples: Snow reported on China in the 1950's
The cub reporter covered New York City

definitions.text: complain about; make a charge against
examples: I reported her to the supervisor
